intro: Rubus hirtus proles humilis, commonly known as the low丛 blackberry, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and thickets. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and local biodiversity.
